text: Allama Khalid Mahmud (17 October 1925 â€“ 14 May 2020) was a Pakistani Sunni Islamic scholar. He was a Justice of the Supreme Court of Pakistan. He created the Islamic Academy in Manchester. He was best known for his works related to Finality of the Prophethood. He was born in Lahore. Mahmood died of problems caused by a fractured hip at a hospital in Manchester on 14 May 2020, aged 94. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2020 deaths Category:People from Lahore Category:Pakistani philosophers Category:Pakistani judges Category:Pakistani Muslims Category:Muslim scholars
title: Khalid Mahmud (judge)
